title: ASUS’ Newest Gaming Monitors come in 20 Different Variants
description: They also come with—you guessed it—AI features. The post ASUS’ Newest Gaming Monitors come in 20 Different Variants appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
excerpt: They also come with—you guessed it—AI features.
text: If you’re in the market for a new ASUS gaming monitor, then you’re in luck—the Taiwanese tech giant recently announced the launch of its new TUF Gaming Series Five monitors, which includes over 20 models each with different specs and hardware configurations, all at varying prices as well. READ: ASUS’ New VivoWatch 6 Aero is Now Official The Series Five range features displays from 23.8 to 34 inches, offering FHD, QHD, or WQHD panels with varying specifications, although one key highlight across the series is “Speed Boost” feature which enabling refresh rates of up to 300Hz and ultra-low response times down to 0.3ms. There are two main flagship models however, which consists of the TUF Series Five VG27AQML5A and the VG34WQML5A. The VG27AQML5A packs a 27-inch QHD panel with a 300Hz refresh rate and a 0.3ms response time, while the VG34WQML5A offers an ultrawide QHD VA panel with a 250Hz refresh rate and a 0.5ms response time. ASUS adds that the TUF Gaming Series Five monitors are designed for “ultrasmooth gameplay” with support for both NVIDIA G-SYNC and AMD FreeSync Premium technologies, as well as ASUS Extreme Low Motion Blur (ELMB) for reduced ghosting during high-frame-rate gaming. The monitors also support up to 95% DCI-P3 color gamut support and VESA DisplayHDR 400. As with most other tech products these days, you’re also getting a dose of AI with features such as Dynamic Crosshair for aiming, Dynamic Shadow Boost for brightening dark areas, and AI Visual that can instantly detect on-screen content and applies optimal display settings. A writer and content creator with a love for tech and music, Mike is also an avid gamer as well. He and his wife are big fans of Mario Kart. html:
If you’re in the market for a new ASUS gaming monitor, then you’re in luck—the Taiwanese tech giant recently announced the launch of its new TUF Gaming Series Five monitors, which includes over 20 models each with different specs and hardware configurations, all at varying prices as well.

READ: ASUS’ New VivoWatch 6 Aero is Now Official

The Series Five range features displays from 23.8 to 34 inches, offering FHD, QHD, or WQHD panels with varying specifications, although one key highlight across the series is “Speed Boost” feature which enabling refresh rates of up to 300Hz and ultra-low response times down to 0.3ms.

There are two main flagship models however, which consists of the TUF Series Five VG27AQML5A and the VG34WQML5A. The VG27AQML5A packs a 27-inch QHD panel with a 300Hz refresh rate and a 0.3ms response time, while the VG34WQML5A offers an ultrawide QHD VA panel with a 250Hz refresh rate and a 0.5ms response time.

ASUS adds that the TUF Gaming Series Five monitors are designed for “ultrasmooth gameplay” with support for both NVIDIA G-SYNC and AMD FreeSync Premium technologies, as well as ASUS Extreme Low Motion Blur (ELMB) for reduced ghosting during high-frame-rate gaming. The monitors also support up to 95% DCI-P3 color gamut support and VESA DisplayHDR 400.

As with most other tech products these days, you’re also getting a dose of AI with features such as Dynamic Crosshair for aiming, Dynamic Shadow Boost for brightening dark areas, and AI Visual that can instantly detect on-screen content and applies optimal display settings.

A writer and content creator with a love for tech and music, Mike is also an avid gamer as well. He and his wife are big fans of Mario Kart.
